text: Government refers to all the following except

options.B: an organized group of people that formulate policies
options.C: a process of making and enforcing laws
options.D: an institution made up of people with common interest

explanation:
Governmenttypically refers to:
An academic field of study: The study of government and political systems is a recognized academic discipline.An organised group of people that formulate policies: This describes how government functions, with organised groups (such as branches or departments) responsible for policy-making.A process of making and enforcing laws: Government involves the creation and enforcement of laws to maintain order and regulate society.
An institution made up of people with common interests, however, refers to organisations or groups that might not be governmental but are focused on shared goals or interests, such as clubs, societies, or special interest groups. These are not necessarily involved in the formal processes of governance.

text: All the following are experienced by a community without government except
explanation:
In a community without government, issues such asinsecurity,lawlessnessandpolitical anarchyare commonly experienced due to the absence of organised structures to maintain order, enforce laws and provide security. However,planned developmentis not experienced in such a community.
Planned developmentrequires structured governance to create and implement development plans and policies. Without a government, there is usually no organised mechanism for planning and executing development projects.

text: As an academic field the study of government does not include
explanation: Government as an academic field of study:- is the study of political institutions and theories, which deals with the acquisition and use of political power. It is a social science subject taught in higher institution.

text: Which of the following systems of government is authoritarian in nature?
explanation:
Fascism is a form of far right-wing, authoritarian ultranationalism characterized by dictatorial power, forcible suppression of opposition, and strong regimentation of society and of the economy
Fascismis a form of government which is a type of one-party dictatorship.Fascistsare against democracy. ...Fascismputs nation and often race above the individual. It stands for a centralized government headed by a dictator.

text: The system that allows the opposition to participate in governance is
explanation: In ademocraticcountry, all eligible citizens have the right to participate, either directly or indirectly, in making the decisions that affect them. It also allows the participation of the opposition in governance

text: Which of the following hinders the establishment of a representative government in a state?
explanation: Illiteracyis a state whereby one is unable to read and write. In its simplest form, it can be defined as lack of any or sufficient education. Sometimes people who have had very basic education also experience challenges in reading and writing. When majority of the electorates are illiterates, electoral malpractice prevalent, making  representative government difficult

text: Which of the following is not an attribute of a state?
explanation: The state has four essential attributes, Population, Territory, Government and Sovereignty. Population and territory constitute the physical basis of the State while government and sovereignty constitute its legal basis or political basis.

text: In a democracy political sovereignty is vested in the
explanation: Popular sovereigntyis the principle that the authority of a state and its government are created and sustained by the consent of its people, through their elected representatives (Rule by the People), who is the source of all political power.

text: According to Charles Montesquieu, the theory of separation of powers is to prevent
explanation:
Baron deMontesquieuin in his book titled '' The Spirit of the Laws, argued for a constitutional government with three separate branches, each of which would have defined abilities to check the powers of the others. This is to prevent cases like arbitrariness.
Arbitrariness isthe quality of being based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system.

text: Decentralisation is a common feature of
explanation: Decentralization—the transfer of authority and responsibility for public functions from the central government to subordinate or quasi-independent government organizations. The governmental powers in a federal system of government is decentralized in a way that, authority and reponsibilities are shared among the federal, state and local government .

text: Bye-laws are made through
explanation:
Delegated legislation means the exercise of legislative power by an agency that is subordinate to the legislature.
Not alllawsaremadeby the government. Some Acts of Parliament give other organisations the power tomakelaws– usually local councils.

text: Power is transformed into legal authority through
explanation: Legitimacy is a political concept which referstothe acceptance and recognition by the citizens of a country the right of their rulerstogovern. Power is  transformed into legal authority by legitimizing it.

text: Conventions are mostly used by states that have

options.B: a lot of people not interested in political activities

explanation: Conventions are mostly used by states that have anunwritten constitution. In such states, conventions are established practices or norms that are not formally codified in written law but are followed as part of the political system. These conventions help guide the functioning of government and fill gaps where the Constitution is silent.

text: One advantage of a flexible constitution is that it

options.C: is best suited for a federation
options.D: can be amended by a simple majority

explanation:
1. A flexible constitution can be amended with the same ease and facility with which ordinary laws are altered. (with a simple majority voting in favor of its amendment)
2.  A flexible constitution can easily adopt the needs of people with the change of time because of its elasticity.
3. A flexible constitution is very useful for developing a country, because it is a great expression of its development. It does not hinder progress due to it's adaptability.
4. Flexible constitution is moulded by the conventions of national life.

text: A constitution that requires complicated procedure for its amendment is
explanation: Rigid constitutionis  a constitution that is difficult or slow to change usually because of a prescribed process of amendment that is detailed and lengthy

text: The official who enforces discipline among members of his party in parliament is the
explanation: The Chief Whip is a political office in some legislatures whose task is to administer the whipping system that tries to ensure that members of the party attend and vote as the party leadership desires.

text: When an action of the executive is declared ultra-vires, it is a control exercised by the
explanation: Ultra-vires means acting or done beyond one's legal power or authority.

text: In a presidential system of government, the president can constitutionally be removed from the office through
explanation: Impeachment is the process by which a legislative body levels charges against a government official. it is one of the ways a president can be removed  from office

text: One of the features of an absolute monarch is that the ruler

options.B: has a definite tenure of office
options.C: is elected by the representatives of the people
options.D: wields the supreme power in a state

explanation: Absolute monarchy, or absolutism, meant that the ultimate authority to run a state was in the hands of a king who ruled by divine right.

text: A notable feature of cabinet system of government is
explanation: The most distinctive characteristic of a Cabinet system of government is the complete and continuous responsibility of the executive to the legislature. Collectively, the Cabinet shapes the programme of legislation which is submitted to Parliament and from it emanates the broad and general policies.

text: All the following are the conditions for the adoption of federalism except
explanation:
Different groups within a country mayadopt federalismas a means of preventing the over-concentration of power at the centre. This is one way in which they can prevent the country from drifting into dictatorship. States with a common historical background can come together to form a federation.
Homogeneity is the quality or state of being all the same or all of the same kind.

text: The privileged citizens enjoyed in a country irrespective of sex, tribe or creed is
explanation: Therightsbelonging to an individual by virtue of citizenship, including civil liberties, due process, equal protection of the laws, and freedom from discrimination.

text: The judicial order requiring a detained person to be brought before a judge is the writ of
explanation: Habeas corpus; is a writ requiring a person under arrest to be brought before a judge or into court, especially to secure the person's release unless lawful grounds are shown for their detention.

text: A political party can contest and win a widely accepted election if it has

options.D: the support of very wealthy politicians

explanation: A political party can win a widely accepted election when it has a broad / wide base of  members and supporters who will vote for the party during elections.

text: Political parties aim at all the following except
explanation: Partymembers in each branch suggest ideas forpartypolicies. They help choose, or pre-select,partycandidates for local, state and federal elections. They also assist with election campaigns, distribute 'how to vote' cards on Election Day, and help scrutinise the counting of votes.

text: Which of the following is not a means through which political parties reach the populace?
explanation:
Political parties typically use various means to reach the populace, including:
Posters: Used for visual communication and advertising in public spaces.Newspapers: Provide news coverage and articles that can be used to convey political messages and party platforms.The internet: Offers a wide range of digital platforms (websites, social media) for engaging with voters and sharing information.
Schools, however, are not used by political parties as a direct means of reaching the populace. While educational institutions may indirectly influence public opinion through education, they are not a primary medium for political campaigning or outreach.

text: An association whose ultimate aim is to influence government policies is known as
explanation: Pressure groupisa group that tries to influence government / public policy in the interest of a particular cause.

text: Membership of pressure groups is usually limited because they

options.D: promote the interest of the government

explanation: Pressure groups often have limited membership because they focus onspecific and narrow objectives. These groups are formed around particular issues or causes, and their appeal may be limited to individuals who are particularly interested in or affected by those issues. This focus helps them to concentrate their efforts and resources effectively, but it also means that their membership base tends to be smaller and more specialised compared to broader organizations.

text: Elections are conducted to

options.A: provide permanent employment for the people
options.B: make the people choose their leaders
options.C: known the number of people in a country
options.D: know the social amenities in the community

explanation: The nature of democracy is that elected officials are accountable to the people, and theymustreturn to the voters at prescribed intervals to seek their mandate to continue in office. Election ensures the citizens choose their preferred candidates to represent them at various elective position

text: Suffrage is also known as
explanation: Suffrage is the right to vote in political elections. It is also known as franchise

text: For an election to be fair and free Electoral Commission must be

options.C: headed by a minister in the executive
options.D: independent of other institutions of government

explanation: An independent electoral commission ensures the conduct of free, fair and credible elections

text: Which of the following categories of people can vote in periodic elections?
explanation:
The following are some of the requirements for voting in an election;
Must be a citizen of that country.At least 18 years of age on or before the date of the next election.A current resident of that country/stateNot in prison or on parole for a felony conviction.

text: The anonymity of a civil servant means that he

options.A: is above the law of the land
options.B: should take part in partisan politics
options.C: receives neither praise nor blame publicly
options.D: should be prosecuted for professional misconduct

explanation: The anonymity of the civil service is linked to two concepts: permanence and neutrality. Civil servants, many of whom remain in their jobs whilst serving numerous governments, are thus likely to have to give advice to governments of different political parties, who may have different attitudes to policy. The advice they give needs to be given to ministers both freely and also without fear of adverse public or political reactions and without fear of future career damage.

text: Which of the following functions is performed by the civil service?
explanation: The Civil service is the entity that is charged with the responsibility of carrying out government policies, providing services to the public and keeping the machinery of government running. One of the functions of the Civil Service is to implement the policies of the government of the day.

text: Public corporations are established to

options.D: provide utility services to the public at minimal cost

explanation: One of the major  reason for establishment of Public Corporation is to lower the prices of the goods and services they provide.

text: A minister controls public corporation by

options.B: auditing the accounts of the corporation personally
options.C: criticizing the corporation through the mass media
options.D: ensuring the effective administration of the corporation

explanation: A minister's role with a public corporation is to oversee and ensure the effective administration of the corporation.

text: An institution of government that makes bye-laws is the
explanation: A byelaw is a law which is made by a body, such as a local authority, under an enabling power established by an Act of Parliament and which has been confirmed by the Secretary of State.

text: Local governments are created to

options.A: give more powers to the traditional rulers
options.B: bring the government closer to the people
options.C: make the people obey more of the local laws
options.D: take over the functions of the central government

explanation: Local government brings about grass root inclusion and development. A grassroots movement is one which uses the people in a given district, region, or community as the basis for a political or economic movement.

text: Some pre-colonial West African governments were democratic because of the existence of
explanation: In pre-colonial West Africa, some governance systems exhibited democratic features due to their internal mechanisms of checks and balances. These mechanisms ensured that power was not concentrated in the hands of a single individual or group. Instead, various institutions or councils had specific roles and powers that balanced each other.

text: One of the measures introduced by indirect rule was

options.A: collection and keeping of taxes by the chiefs only
options.C: fixing and collection of taxes by British officials themselves
options.D: exclusion of the educated elite from the colonial administration

explanation: Educated elites were excluded in the administration of the colonial indirect rule system

text: Which of the following policies was replaced by the French Policy of Association?
explanation: The assimilation policy was a policy of absorbing Aboriginal people into white society through the process of removing children from their families. The ultimate intent of this policy was the destruction of Aboriginal society.

text: The appointment and deposition of chiefs by their people was a demand of the

options.B: National Congress of British West Africa

explanation: TheNational Congress of British West Africa (NCBWA)was a significant Pan-African and nationalist organization founded in 1944. It sought to address various issues affecting West Africa under colonial rule, including the political and social rights of the people. One of its key demands was for greater local control and autonomy, which included the appointment and deposition of chiefs by their own communities rather than by colonial authorities.

text: The desire for constitutional development in British West African Colonies was as a result of the

options.B: desire of the British to review the constitution
options.C: power of traditional rulers in British West Africa
options.D: growing agitation of the people for political independence

explanation: The desire for constitutional development in British West African colonies stemmed primarily from the growing agitation of the people for political independence. As the people became more aware of their rights and the need for self-governance, they increasingly demanded reforms and constitutional changes that would lead to greater autonomy and eventual independence from British colonial rule. This movement was driven by educated elites, nationalists, and other groups pushing for political and social reforms.

text: The following are features of military regimes except
explanation: Military regimes are often characterised bysuspension of the constitution,rule by decrees and edictsandcurtailment of human rights. However, they are not typically associated withrespect for human rights. Instead, military governments tend to prioritise control and order at the expense of individual freedoms and rights.

text: Military regimes in West Africa have often made use of civilians because

options.C: civilians are part of the armed forces
options.D: they need the experience of civilians in government

explanation: Military regimes in West Africa have often included civilians in their governments because civilians possess the necessary experience, expertise and knowledge of governance that military officers typically lack. While military officers may have control over the armed forces and security, civilians are often more familiar with the complexities of administration, law, economics and other aspects of government.

text: One criticism levelled against the pre-independence political parties in West Africa was that some of them

options.B: did not contribute to political development
options.D: were instruments of the colonial administration

explanation: One major criticism of the pre-independence political parties in West Africa was that they often lacked anational outlook. This means that many of these parties were regionally or ethnically based, focusing on the interests of specific groups rather than representing the entire nation. This lack of a national perspective hindered their ability to unify the country and build a broad-based political movement that could effectively challenge colonial rule and promote national independence.

text: Foreign policy is the

options.A: general principles that guide foreigners in a country
options.B: policy made by a country during war
options.C: policy made by a country in peace time
options.D: general principles of a country in the conduct of international relations

explanation: Foreign policy is simply a government's strategy in dealing with other nations.

text: The Commonwealth of Nations was originally made up of

options.C: independent nations formerly under British Empire
options.D: France and her former colonies in West Africa

explanation: The Commonwealth was first officially formed in 1926 when the Balfour Declaration of the Imperial Conference recognized the full sovereignty of dominions. Known as the "British Commonwealth", the original members were the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, Irish Free State, and Newfoundland.

text: Which of the following countries was not instrumental to the formation of the United Nations Organization (UNO)?
explanation: TheUnited Nations Organization (UNO)was established in 1945 after World War II to promote peace, security and cooperation among nations. The founding members included theUnited States of America,Britain, theUSSR, and many other countries.Germanywas not instrumental in the formation of the UNO because it was one of the defeated Axis powers in World War II and was not involved in the initial establishment of the organisation.
